archdesc.bioghist: David Sebre Howard (1843-1923) was a Pontiac, Mich. businessman and Mayor in the 1890s. He attended the State Normal School in Ypsilanti, Mich., then enlisted in Company E, 17th Michigan Infantry in 1861. After he was honorably discharged in 1863, Howard became Superintendant for the Oil Transportation Company in Oil City, Penn. He returned to Michigan in 1868 where he married Julia Comstock. The couple settled in Pontiac, Mich.
archdesc.scopecontent: Exchanges between David and Julia Howard, and family members, dated between 1878 and 1881.
